instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.GPUVCORE_EN: What is GPUVCORE_EN? GPUVCORE_EN enables GPU VCORE when it is high, a power rail necessary for the GPU to function so you can get an image on the screen. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15” Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: I haven't seen this type of failure with the usual video chip failure of this generation. Normally I'll get distorted video or a non-posting or non-booting situation. Is this the video chip failing or should I be looking for something else? Not a spill, just came in booting but no video. Tried a test screen, same thing.

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: Rare but possible. Have you  tapped <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> with your fingernail?

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: Ok, pushed on it with a spudger and no change.

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: Bad GPU probably, heat it up and try again.

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: I got it pretty toasty. No change.

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: Yes, sorry, left that out. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is good - 3.4V. <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> is at 0V. No external video.

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: 10Ω to ground. Seems decent. Not sure exactly what the 17" board should be at but that doesn't seem too far off, if at all.

2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: If voltage is present on pin14 it looks like a dead <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>.

threads.title: 2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
threads.message: <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> seems dead to me, or one of the FETs.

2011 17" <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Board. Boots, no video. Usual Issue?
